children.subject:
One additional important piece of information I'd like to raise up is that campus Academic Senate rules (for a small # of years now) is that faculty can only sponsor one decal each in a given semester (without the dean granting an exception).  It's student facilitator responsibility to flag that when they approach a professor as a potential sponsor of your decal.    The department has been lax in enforcement of this and has gotten significant push back from the Academic Senate.

For Fall 2019 and moving forward, we will just deny proposals that come in after we've already approved a decal for a particular proposed faculty sponsor.

history.content:
Updates:


1. The course proposal form and related checklists have been updated. The revised forms were released in October 2018 and will be the only accepted forms starting for Fall 2019. You can access the form under the required documents section and identify the latest version by referring to the bottom, right corner of the form, noting the “v.10.2018” footnote marker.

2. All student facilitators must complete the training requirement before submitting their proposal. Anyone listed as a student facilitator on the DeCal syllabus must complete the training requirement. If you have completed the training in the past, you do not need to complete it again. The Undergraduate Course Facilitator Training & Resources (UCFTR) program hosts multiple trainings across each semester. It is recommended that you review the training dates now and complete the training before the end of the Spring semester. The next trainings will take place the first week of April.

Deadlines:

All Fall 2019 DeCal proposals need to be delivered to the Chairs' Assistants no later than July 9, 2019. Late/incomplete submissions will not be accepted. It is strongly recommended that you submit your documents before the Spring semester is over (last training on the UCFTR website for Spr19 semester is May 2nd).

For more information, review the EECS DeCal process here: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/decal
